Transition Graph#

Transition Graph Class#

class retentioneering.transition_graph.transition_graph.TransitionGraph(eventstream, graph_settings, norm_type=None, weights=None, targets=None, thresholds=None)[source]#

Class that holds methods for graph visualization.

plot_graph(thresholds=None, targets=None, weights=None, norm_type=None, width=960, height=900, weight_template=None, show_weights=None, show_percents=None, show_nodes_names=None, show_all_edges_for_targets=None, show_nodes_without_links=None)[source]#

Create interactive graph visualization with callback to input eventstream.

Parameters:
thresholdsdict{}

Minimal edge and node weight value to be rendered on a graph. Nodes specified in targets parameter will be always shown regardless selected threshold. Example: {‘nodes’: {‘events’: 0.03}, ‘edges’: {‘events’ : 0.03}}

targetsdict, optional

Event mapping describing which nodes or edges should be highlighted by different colors for better visualization.

  • keys are values from schema.event_name column.

  • values - have the following possible values and corresponded colores:

    • nice - green

    • bad - red

    • source - yellow

Example: {‘lost’: ‘bad’, ‘purchased’: ‘nice’, ‘main’: ‘source’}

weightsdict
norm_type{“full”, “node”, None}, default None

Type of normalization used to calculate weights for graph edges.

widthint, default 960

Width of plot in pixels.

heightint, default 960

Height of plot in pixels.

weight_templatestr, optional
show_weightsbool, optional
show_percentsbool, optional
show_nodes_namesbool, optional
show_all_edges_for_targetsbool, optional
show_nodes_without_linksbool, optional
Returns:
Rendered IFrame graph

Eventstream#

Eventstream.transition_graph(thresholds=None, norm_type=None, weights=None, targets=None, width=960, height=900)[source]#

Create interactive graph visualization with callback to input eventstream. See parameters description retentioneering.transition_graph.transition_graph()

Returns:
TransitionGraph

A TransitionGraph class instance fitted to the given parameters.

Eventstream.transition_matrix(weights=None, norm_type=None)[source]#

Create edge graph in the matrix format. Row indexes are events, from which the transition occurred, and columns are events, to which the transition occurred. The values are weights of the edges defined with weights and norm_type parameters.

Parameters:
weights
norm_type{“full”, “node”, None}, default None
Returns:
pd.DataFrame
